text: - I'm Mike Vitti.

I'm the Senior Vice President
of Data and Decision Science
for the PGA Tour.

Our IT team is the central
data and analytics team
for the PGA Tour.
We support the entire organization

when it comes to data as
well as for data science,

decision science, as well as
anything you do with data.
We run golf tournaments.
We run golf courses.

We partner with other
golf host organizations.
We have a lot of complex data.
We have a lot of small data sets.
We do a lot of different businesses.

What we needed to do is
bring that data together
and find the disparate pieces
of data that actually fit together
and bring them in.
And as we did that, you know,
when you're bringing in this data,
it's all very varied and different.

Some of it's actually video,
some of it's gonna be audio,
and some of it is actually text,

and you can't store that in
the traditional database.

We actually solve a lot
of challenges with AWS,
but in particular, in my area,

we built the first data
lake for the PGA Tour.
We had a lot of disparate data.

We had a lot of things going
all over the organization.
We actually built a data lake in order
to bring all that information together,

and then be able to push
that information out

to the organization and
allow different departments
to see other information
that they didn't have access
to before to make better decisions.

When I came to the Tour to
build out the data organization,

I knew what we needed to do
quickly and be successful at it.

And I had a lot of success
with AWS in the past,
and so they always meet,
or exceed the expectations I have.
S3 is the central tenant of our data lake.
It's everything comes in first to S3.

So it's the basis and the
foundation of the data lake,
and from there we build out.

I like how they evolve
their model all the time.
I knew that, we know with S3 especially,

I can actually bring all that
information together quickly,
and that's a big thing.

As you're starting to
build something like this,
you don't have time for people to worry
about the back end, right?
You don't want them,
they wanna see things on the front end.
So in order to get momentum,

when you're building stuff
from scratch like this,
or building from the ground up,
you want to have momentum quickly.

It's actually a benefit
to our business greatly

because we've now brought all
our data to a central area.

We have central analytics
we can now report off of.

It allows us to bring in
new data sets all the time.

We've got different data about
our fans to try to understand
them to build our product better.

This allows us to quickly
do that and then move on
and to keep improving our products.
(music fades)
